titleStmt.title: Thomas Gray and ?? to Norton Nicholls (7 June 1769)

availability.p: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.
The original letter is extant and usually available for academic research purposes

adminInfo.note: bound into a copy of Mathias's Works of Thomas Gray (London, 1814), vol. II, part 2; a photocopy is at the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, OSB MSS c 467, box 1, folder 83

listBibl.bibl: Correspondence of Thomas Gray, 3 vols. Ed. by the late Paget Toynbee and Leonard Whibley, with corrections and additions by H. W. Starr. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1971 [1st ed. 1935], letter no. 496, vol. iii, 1061 http://www.e-enlightenment.com/search/letters/print/?printref_sourceedition=graythOU0084&printref_docnumber=496

The Letters of Thomas Gray, including the correspondence of Gray and Mason, 3 vols. Ed. by Duncan C. Tovey. London: George Bell and Sons, 1900-12, letter no. CCCXLV, vol. iii, 224 https://www.thomasgray.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi?collection=primary&sequence=ToD_1900iii:224
The Works of Thomas Gray, 5 vols. Ed. by John Mitford. London: W. Pickering, 1835-1843, letter XXI, vol. v, 95 https://www.thomasgray.org/cgi-bin/view.cgi?collection=primary&sequence=MiJ_1843v:95

projectDesc.p: This letter is part of the Primary Texts section of the Thomas Gray Archive.
XML created for the Thomas Gray Archive.

editorialDecl.p: This letter is part of the correspondence calendar of the complete correspondence of Thomas Gray. The calendar contains detailed bibliographic records for all known original, copied, or published letters written by or to the poet as well as the full-text, where available. Each record is accompanied by digitised images of the manuscript, where available, or digitised images of the first printed edition.

taxonomy.bibl: Library of Congress Name Authority File (LCNAF)

body.p: I have just recollected that Mr Boycot may possibly be able to give you some assistance.

postscript.p: P:S: Well! why, you don't say any thing to me. here am I; & as soon as our ceremonies are over, look with your telescope at the top of Skiddaw, & you will see me.
